overview_summary: All three profiled neighbors are rural landowners with no documented public stance on development or clean energy. None hold notable public roles in the community, indicating generally low influence. Their positions on the project remain unknown, with no evidence of overt support or opposition to date.

neighbors.name: Jeffrey Boyce
neighbors.claims: Public records list Jeffrey Boyce as a landowner in the rural Town of Alabama, Genesee County ([gisp.geneseeny.gov](https://gisp.geneseeny.gov/PHD/Viewer/default.aspx#:~:text=Swis%2FMunicipality%3A%20,Tax%20Map)). No local meeting minutes or news reports show Boyce voicing any opinion on recent development proposals (e.g., only one resident spoke at a 2020 solar farm hearing, and it was not Boyce) ([www.thebatavian.com](https://www.thebatavian.com/tags/town-of-alabama#:~:text=match%20at%20L347%20The%20sole,solar%20farms%20on%20prime%20farmland)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Connect via agricultural community channels. Emphasize respect for farmland use and address any concerns privately to build trust.

neighbors.name: Brice Johnson
neighbors.claims: Brice Johnson owns a parcel of land in Genesee County’s northwest area, with records indicating a property in the Town of Alabama ([gisp.geneseeny.gov](https://gisp.geneseeny.gov/PHD/Viewer/default.aspx#:~:text=Swis%2FMunicipality%3A%20,Tax%20Map)). There is no record of Johnson participating in town meetings or public forums about development; for instance, a key hearing on solar farms in Alabama drew only one resident speaker (not Johnson) ([www.thebatavian.com](https://www.thebatavian.com/tags/town-of-alabama#:~:text=match%20at%20L347%20The%20sole,solar%20farms%20on%20prime%20farmland)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out through mutual local contacts or neighboring farmers. Provide clear, factual information and listen to any of his property or privacy concerns.

neighbors.name: Ellen Hersee
neighbors.claims: Ellen Hersee is identified in county property records as a landowner on a rural parcel in Genesee County ([gisp.geneseeny.gov](https://gisp.geneseeny.gov/PHD/Viewer/default.aspx#:~:text=Swis%2FMunicipality%3A%20,Tax%20Map)). Hersee has not been mentioned in local news or public hearings regarding development; notably, recent town discussions on solar projects saw no input from her on record ([www.thebatavian.com](https://www.thebatavian.com/tags/town-of-alabama#:~:text=match%20at%20L347%20The%20sole,solar%20farms%20on%20prime%20farmland)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach in a neighborly manner via community events or local introductions. Emphasize listening to her views and quietly addressing any questions about land use or project impact.
